column1: '''Fritz Möser''' ([[19 October]] [[1932]] - February [[2013]]) was a German artist.<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.eart.de/eigen/displayartist.cfm?ArtistID=1323|articlename=Fritz Möser|dated=|website=[http://www.eart.de/index.cfm eART.de]|accessed=3 June 2012}}</ref> Apparently [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] was aware of Möser's artwork
column2: as he was seemingly interested in Möser creating illustrations for  translations of his works in Germany.<ref>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]]
column3: "[[Letter to Hans-Jörg Modlmayr (16 March 1967)]]" (letter)</ref><ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://newboards.theonering.net/forum/gforum/perl/gforum.cgi?post=452405;sb=post_time;so=DESC;forum_view=forum_view_collapsed;guest=19262590|articlename=Tolkien - 'I have never been a lover of books for children..'|dated=|website=[http://newboards.theonering.net/forum/gforum/perl/gforum.cgi?guest=19262590 The One Ring Forums]|accessed=3 June 2012}}</ref>
